debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A2 uses christianity to prove christianity exist, which doesn't make a valid argument.
A1 makes the statement that we are all entitled to our own beliefs, where A2 makes it feel as though anything other than Christianity is wrong.
A1 doesn't really stay on topic or attempt to make an argument.
A1 is unclear as to where they actually stand on the issue. A2 offers a simple but logical argument for their point.
both arguments are replies to other respondents.

arg2.originalHTML:
False Dichotomy.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I would also like to point that atheism predates Christianity, destroying your "test of time" argument (which was bullshit to begin with- argumentum ad populum). In fact, by definition, atheism predates religion.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

neither are convincing--they don't really argue why one is better or more important than the other.
A1 doesn't use profanity in its argument.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 makes a very brief comment/point and it's a personal one - one only of a similar view will agree with.

2 shows there is more to faith than denying science
A2 provides much more detail to support their point of view
A2 gives reasoning behind the position in support of Christianity while A1 only gives a narrow, single-person viewpoint.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

A2 uses examples and points out inconsistencies to support the argument.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: Both arguments have simple personal reasons for their claims that are not based on factual evidence
A1 falls short of argument as it is merely a statement of personal conviction
a1 has better facts than a2 has.
A2 doesn't take a single side in the debate
A2 is too judgemental. A1 states the person's belief more clearly without attacking other viewpoints.

Everyone knows evolution is a load of crap.

The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A2 strongly states a belief and a reason for that belief. A1 questions.
A1 offers (some) basis for argument, while A2 only states the writer's opinion.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 focuses on the existence of god.
both contain similar opinions to support their belief in christianity.

mTurkAssignment.reason: A1 is incorrect, and A2 is not bringing evidence.

debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: because A1 is attacking people with an opposite opinion.
Neither gives great arguments or details to support itself.
A1 makes the reader think about what would happen if his or her belief is wrong or right. A2 is a personal choice.
Neither make a any points, one trys to scare you the other just says they follow the pack.
mTurkAssignment.hitComment: These are very popular topics, enjoyed reading others thoughts

mTurkAssignment.reason: neither one of these are convincing to me and neither one answers the question.

debateMetaData.title: Christianity or Atheism?
debateMetaData.description: Oh no, did I ask the great question that atheists can't stand to hear? Perhaps the negative position may be that the term "atheism" is incorrect? The argument that a person cannot be a christian because of his or her flaws is also quite weak. Christianity will stand the test of time as God is the one and the only. Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

Scientists make scientific errors all of the time. Jesus Christ has never made a mistake and prophecies in the Bible have been and are still being fulfilled today. God has been a gracious Father to provide both the atheist and christian the solid evidence of His truth.

mTurkAssignment.reason: it gives a good example of how the common folk actually are.
A2 is arguing against Christianity.
A2 supports the opposite of the standpoint.
both arguments are statements of personal religious preference and nothing more.
A2 agrees with the opposing argument, A1 is arguing for this standpoint

arg1.author: Th3ZViru5
arg1.text: I was raised in a Freewill Baptist Church and was lucky to encounter a church full of people who were actually kind and practiced what they preached. Now, I consider myself a non-denominational who still wholly believes in the beliefs and teachings of the Christians, only now I see it like this: I believe in God, not religion.

arg2.author: ChuckHades
arg2.text: Well, as an active Pastafarian, I am disappointed at the lack of recognition of our religion. Along with Islam, Judaism, Mormonism, Roman mythology, Greek mythology, Norse mythology, Hinduism, Sikhism, Jainism, Egyptian mythology, and Buddhism. But seeing as I am a theist, I must be on this side. Don't you wish there was a sarcasm feature on the internet?
